definition: disgrace/dishonor/to insult/to bring disgrace or humiliation to/to be indebted to/self-deprecating/Taiwan pr. [ru4]
to eat humble pie/to accept humiliation/to turn the other cheek

sentences.english: Even so, the peace activists of the day reacted to the news of his Nobel Prize with mortification.
sentences.chinese: 當時的和平活動家們也對他成爲諾獎得主感到恥辱。

sentences.english: This was a mark of great shame and disgrace.
sentences.chinese: 這在當時是恥辱與不光彩的標誌。

sentences.english: Word of it has spread and you have dishonoured yourself here in Benares.
sentences.chinese: 此事傳遍了貝拿勒斯，呆在這裏你只有恥辱。

sentences.english: Every pratfall loss brings them closer to history.
sentences.chinese: 每一次恥辱的失敗都讓他們離那個歷史記錄更近。

sentences.english: The humiliating grip of corruption and tyranny is being pried open.
sentences.chinese: 腐敗和暴政的恥辱枷鎖已被打開。

sentences.english: They pant for an opportunity of revenging that humiliation;
sentences.chinese: 他們渴望着一次洗涮恥辱，報仇的機會。

sentences.english: Four years ago, he suffered an ignominious first-round exit.
sentences.chinese: 四年前，他遭受了首輪出局的恥辱。

sentences.english: What a sham. What kind of a show are you guys puttin' on here today?
sentences.chinese: 真是恥辱。你們今天給我看的是什麼東西？

sentences.english: It would be a disgrace if California outsources this project.
sentences.chinese: 如果加州將這個項目外包，那將是個恥辱。

sentences.english: Would you bring infamy on your sacred profession?
sentences.chinese: 你願意給你神聖的職業蒙受恥辱嗎？

sentences.english: The greatest disgrace is-selling the soul.
sentences.chinese: 最大的恥辱是出賣靈魂。

sentences.english: The schools and education system, it is an absolute disgrace," said Matsakis.
sentences.chinese: 學校和教育系統則完全是一個恥辱。

sentences.english: We live under circumstances where every defeat is an absolutely a disgrace and an earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 我們的生存狀況是，每次的失利都是恥辱和衝擊。

sentences.english: This can mean that those with HIV/AIDS are stigmatised.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着那些HIV艾滋病患者被打上了恥辱烙印。

sentences.english: Fall is a disgrace, stand up is dignity.
sentences.chinese: 跌下去是恥辱，站起來是尊嚴。

sentences.english: There is no more shameful act than pretending to know what one does not.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼比不懂裝懂更讓人感到恥辱。

definition: as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
